newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks end on feeble tone, sentiment bleak.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks end on feeble tone, sentiment bleak.

text.p: Tokyo stocks ended on a feeble tone on Tuesday after wandering in negative territory throughout the session.
Brokers said the market was unable to recover from bleak sentiment brought about by the Lower House elections on Sunday.
The Nikkei 225 closed at 21,123.68, down 0.84 percent or 179.27 points. Its December futures fell 140 points to 21,170.

"The bottom was fairly limited," said Katsuhiko Kodama, general manager at Toyo Securities. "Foreign investors were not selling fiercely, and bargain hunters went into action whenever the benchmark dipped."
